response.raw:
Here is the memo for answering telephones and directing calls:
<OUTPUT_TEXT>
MEMO
To: Medical Office Staff
From: [Your Name], Senior Medical Secretary and Administrative Assistant
Subject: Answering Telephones and Directing Calls
Date: [Current Date]
As the first point of contact for patients and other callers to our medical office, it is critical that we handle all incoming telephone calls in a professional, courteous, and efficient manner. Please follow these guidelines when answering calls:
• Answer the phone within 3 rings with a friendly greeting: "Good morning/afternoon, [Practice Name], this is [Your Name]. How may I assist you today?"
• Listen carefully to the caller's request or inquiry. If the call is for a provider or other staff member, politely say "Please hold while I transfer you" and transfer the call to the appropriate extension.
• If the staff member is unavailable, offer to take a message or send to voicemail: "Dr. [Name] is with a patient at the moment. Would you like me to take a message or send you to Dr. [Name]'s confidential voicemail?"
• For general inquiries, answer the caller's questions if you are able to do so. If not, transfer to the appropriate staff member for assistance.
• Always thank the caller at the end of the conversation.
By following these telephone protocols consistently, we will ensure our patients and callers receive the responsive, high-quality service they expect from our practice. Please let me know if you have any questions.
</OUTPUT_TEXT>
